intro: Hieracium sciadophorum subsp. chaunothyrsum, commonly known as the shadow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. It is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions, making it a common sight in shaded habitats.
